meanings.sent1: I saw a rotte of rats scurrying across the alley.
meanings.sent2: The rotte of rats made the garbage cans their home.
meanings.sent3: The rotte of rats held a meeting in the abandoned building.
meanings.sent4: The rotte of rats seemed to have a leader guiding them.
meanings.sent5: The rotte of rats left a trail of destruction in their wake.

meanings.sent1: The fruit began to rotte after being left out in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Leaves rotte on the forest floor, returning nutrients to the soil.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich started to rotte in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Neglected food can rotte and attract unwanted pests.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stump slowly began to rotte away.

meanings.sent1: The protest turned into a rotte, causing chaos in the streets.
meanings.sent2: A rotte of fans rushed towards the stage after the concert.
meanings.sent3: The shopping mall was filled with a rotte of excited shoppers.
meanings.sent4: The rotte of people pushed and shoved to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent5: The rotte of students flooded out of the school after the bell rang.
